definition: to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: One of the 12 spies and a leader of Israel after Joshua.
sentences.chinese: 也是12暗探之一和繼約書亞後以色列的領袖。

sentences.english: The spy dived quickly into a doorway.
sentences.chinese: 那名暗探急忙鑽進門口。

sentences.english: It is the spy seated in the central stronghold of the ego.
sentences.chinese: 它是安插在自我的中心堡壘中的暗探。

sentences.english: The police have got a tail on the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 警察僱到一名暗探跟蹤罪犯。

sentences.english: I have two men who hid in his company.
sentences.chinese: 在他的公司有我的兩個暗探。

definition: intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
submerged piles installed to prevent the passage of boats/(fig.) informer/spy
to pry into/to spy on/to probe into
to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks
eyes and ears/sb's attention or notice/information/knowledge/spies
